title: What Is a Logical Fallacy?
description: Learn What Is a Logical Fallacy? in one minute.

hook.text: An argument can sound persuasive, feel logical, and still be completely wrong. That's a fallacy.

buildup.text: A logical fallacy is a flaw in reasoning that undermines an argument's logic â€” regardless of whether the conclusion is true.

discovery.text: Aristotle cataloged 13 fallacies in 350 BC. Two millennia later, we've identified over 100 â€” and still fall for them.

twist.text: A fallacy doesn't mean the conclusion is wrong. It means the reasoning doesn't support it.

climax.text: Fallacies persist because they mimic good reasoning. They're convincing â€” that's what makes them dangerous.

punchline.text: Bad logic can reach good conclusions. That's the trap.
